title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during ongoing legal proceedings. This action aims to protect the CFPB's operations until a final decision is made.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to halt the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during ongoing legal proceedings. This measure is intended to safeguard the CFPB's operations until a final ruling is determined.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has announced in its latest Windows 11 Insider Preview that it will remove a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up Windows 11 devices without an internet connection and logging in. This change enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and to use an account for setup.
summary: Microsoft will update Windows 11 to eliminate a script that permitted offline setup, mandating internet connection and account login for device configuration.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway and will continue until Monday, March 31st. The sale features dozens of deals that are available to all customers, not just Amazon Prime members. A comprehensive roundup includes over 100 deals on popular gear, while this particular post focuses on providing affordable options.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is happening now and will last until March 31st. This event offers numerous deals to all customers, not just Prime members. The sale includes a wide selection of over 100 discounts on popular items, with an emphasis on affordability.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. The transaction values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion of debt. This acquisition comes a few years after Musk initially purchased Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has purchased the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion in debt. This acquisition follows Musk's initial purchase of Twitter for $44 billion a few years ago.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), a feature aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that fail to boot. This development, first announced last year, is a response to prevent incidents similar to the previous year's Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is currently testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This tool is designed to help IT professionals remotely fix devices that won't start. This initiative was introduced following the Crowdstrike incident last year, aiming to enhance system recovery processes.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to a Google account until next year. This change comes after Google acquired Fitbit in early 2021 and initially set a 2025 deadline for account migration. The extension was communicated to Fitbit users via email.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts until next year. This decision follows Google's acquisition of Fitbit in 2021, with an initial migration deadline set for 2025. Fitbit users were informed of this extension through an email.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time
snippets: The Metals Company (TMC), which aims to initiate deep-sea mining, has sought closer ties with the Trump administration following challenges in international negotiations. Initially, TMC was sponsored by the island nation of Nauru, leading to a rush in 2021 to establish regulations for deep-sea mining.
summary: The Metals Company (TMC), focused on starting deep-sea mining, sought to strengthen its relationship with the Trump administration after facing difficulties in global talks. Initially backed by Nauru, TMC's push in 2021 to create deep-sea mining regulations highlighted its efforts to advance its mining interests.
